pageIntro: Short, beginner-friendly lessons on blockchain and the Stellar network. No prior knowledge required.

status.comingSoon: Practice for this lesson will follow shortly.
status.testnetOnly: Use TESTNET only. Never enter real secret keys. We do not store secrets.

import.title: Import progress
import.summary: Summary: {lessons} lessons, {stars} stars total. Practice metadata: {meta}

lesson1.title: A blockchain is a decentralized digital ledger that records transactions across multiple computers in such a way that the registered transactions cannot be altered retroactively. It is typically used to ensure the security and transparency of data, often associated with cryptocurrencies but applicable to various other sectors.
lesson1.task: Assemble building blocks (Transaktionen) into a chain
lesson1.learningOutcome: A blockchain is an immutable digital ledger that everyone collectively verifies.

lesson2.title: Understand Stellar
lesson2.goal: Know the difference compared to other blockchains.
lesson2.task: Send token to friend (Simulation) and see speed
lesson2.learningOutcome: Stellar is fast, affordable, and doesn't involve mining.

lesson3.title: Public & Privacy
lesson3.task: View public transaction and guess if one knows who is sending.
lesson3.learningOutcome: Everything is visible, but no one knows the real name.

lesson4.title: Your account
lesson4.goal: Understanding the structure and significance of public/private keys.
lesson4.task: Matching Game: What is public, what is secret
lesson4.learningOutcome: Only the Secret Key provides access; the Public Key may be shared.

lesson5.title: Send & Receive
lesson5.goal: Understanding How Transactions and Trustlines Work
lesson5.task: Execute test transmission and view fee
lesson5.learningOutcome: Each transaction incurs a small fee; Trustline = permission to receive.

lesson6.title: Token & Trading
lesson6.task: Place a token on a virtual marketplace and observe price changes.
lesson6.learningOutcome: Price is determined by supply and demand.

lesson7.title: Security
lesson7.task: Sorting correct/incorrect actions; detecting fake tokens
lesson7.learningOutcome: Keeping the key confidential, storing it securely, and using the testnet.

lesson8.title: Verification & Identity
lesson8.learningOutcome: KYC = Identity verification, verification shows trustworthy tokens.

lesson9.title: Zero Knowledge
lesson9.task: Example scenario 'I am over 18' without showing date of birth
lesson9.learningOutcome: One can prove something without revealing secrets.

lesson10.title: Practice with SKM
lesson10.task: Create an account in the testnet, activate it, set a trustline, send tokens.
lesson10.learningOutcome: Trace the technical processes of a transaction.

lesson11.title: Responsibility
lesson11.task: Decision-making game: act correctly or not
lesson11.learningOutcome: Blockchain is final; due diligence is a must.

lesson12.title: Conclusion / Playful Learning
lesson12.learningOutcome: Review learned material, recognize personal progress.

lesson13.title: Multisig for Beginners
lesson13.goal: Understanding the Fundamental Principles of Multisig
lesson13.task: Compare Single-Sig vs. Multisig and examine an example process.
lesson13.learningOutcome: Multiple signatures increase security; thresholds determine how many signatures are needed.
